# a timely manner

## problem

![image](https://github.com/quasar098/ctf-writeups/assets/70716985/45f64528-fcda-4a65-bc48-2d51afdf7c52)

see [flag.zip](./flag.zip)

## solution

well the title and descriptions are big hints that the flag is in the time, so i tried unzipping the file and looking at the date and time section, but i didn't know what to do from there, but then i realized that it's a zip file and so i was able to view the time bytes from there 

hexdump of flag.zip
```

00000010: 066f 3300 0000 3900 0000 0800 1c00 6669  .o3...9.......fi

00000a80: 0500 0356 3ca5 7075 780b 0001 04e8 0300  ...V<.pux.......
00000a90: 0004 e803 0000 504b 0506 0000 0000 0e00  ......PK........
00000aa0: 0e00 3a04 0000 5c06 0000 0000            ..:...\.....
```

so now i looked at the wikipedia article on the zip file format ([here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZIP_(file_format)#Central_directory_file_header)) to find where the last modification time would be

i used the `PK` strings to find the start of each central directory file header, and then looked at the file name to find which files are which and which order they go in

so the flag is `ictf{Th1sFl@gI5C@m3lC@s3B3cau5eUnd3rsc0r3sAr3Ann0y!ng}`
